title.narrative: INTEGRATED SOCIAL PROTECTION AND PROMOTION PROJECT

description.narrative: The development objective for the Integrated Social Protection and Promotion Project for the Dominican Republic is to improve access of the borrower's poor citizens to an integrated package of social protection and promotion opportunities, including, in particular, human capital, enhanced employability, and housing improvements in selected provinces. The project has three components. (1) Integrated area-based social protection and pro-poor service delivery component aims to improve access of poor citizens of selected provinces to an integrated package of social protection and promotion opportunities by bridging conditional cash transfer (CCT) coverage gaps for eligible extremely poor households, increasing access of extremely poor CCT users to housing improvements, and increasing access of extremely and moderately poor CCT users to productive opportunities. (2) Strengthening of the Progresando con Solidaridad (PROSOLI) CCT Program and support to targeted households component will strengthen operational processes and its capacity to effectively link targeted households to newly available opportunities and services in selected provinces. (3) Enhancing equity and results orientation component will complement targeted interventions at the territorial level with institutional strengthening at the national policy level to sustain progress in building blocks of the social protection system. The project directly benefits a significant share of current and new PROSOLI users, who will be receiving cash transfers aiming to increase household consumption and human capital investments and to improve beneficiaries' health, nutrition, education, and productivity.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Appoint technical auditing firm to carry out semi-annual verification | Description :Schedule 2. SectionII.CAppoint, under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank, and thereafter maintain throughout Project implementation, anindependent technical auditing firm with qualifications and terms of contracting acceptable to the Bank (Technical Auditor) tocarry out the semi-annual verification - Due no later than 3 months after effective date. | Due Date :January 30-2015

Finance Agreement :Carry out the Project in accordance with OM and PROSOLI OM | Description :Schedule 2. Section I.A.3 (b) (i) (A)and Schedule 2. Section I.C.2Carry out the Project in accordance with the provisions and requirements of the Project OperationsManual and the PROSOLI Operations Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Maintain the SENASA and INFOTEP Inter-institutional Agreements | Description :Schedule 2. Section I.A.2SocialCabinet shall maintain the SENASA and INFOTEP Inter-institutional Agreements. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Social Cabinet will operate and maintain the UTP | Description :Schedule 2. Section I.A.1Social Cabinet will beresponsible for the implementation of the Project and will operate and maintain, throughout Project implementation, the UTP withstructure, staff, functions, responsibilities, and resources acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Employment rate of PROSOLI users (men and women) 18-29 years in selected provinces who receive vocational training, versus that of the control group.
Percentage of beneficiary households whose dirt floors were replaced reporting an improvement in living conditions.
Percentage of eligible households whose socio-economic situation is updated by SIUBEN based on the SIUBEN III socio economic categorization.
Number of Beneficiaries of vocational training package
Number of community report card cycles implemented and supervision initiated in the 14 provinces
Number of “Puntos Solidarios” equipped and functioning in the 14 provinces
Number of modules of the Integrated Monitoring and Evaluation System (SIME) developed and functioning
Percentage of participants from PROSOLI households categorized as ICVI and ICV2 that finish vocational training
Percentage of vocational training participants who are women
Percentage of eligible extremely poor PROSOLI users in selected provinces with dirt floors replaced by reinforced cement floors.
Percentage of PROSOLI field staff trained on new integrated territorial intervention strategy in selected provinces
Percentage of eligible PROSOLI ICV-I and ICV 2 household members newly incorporated by the National helath Insurance Program SENASA.
Number of entities associated with the GCPS trained and applying instruments to assess performance of priority social protection programs
Percentage of household members, categorized as ICV I and ICV2 who meet eligibility criteria, identified and incorporated by PROSOLI into the ILAE program in selected provinces.
Percentage of household members, categorized as ICV I and ICV 2 who meet eligibility criteria, identified and incorporated into Bono Escolar Estudiando Progreso in selected provinces.
Percentage of extremely and moderate poor households who are incorporated in CCT PROSOLI in selected provinces
Customer Relation Management System (CRM) developed and functioning
Technological platform for information exchange between SIUBEN and other public institutions is developed and implemented
